intro: Caucalis daucoides subsp. leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaved cicely, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. This subspecies is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shady woodland habitats. The plant has a distinctive aromatic scent, typical of the carrot family. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
